title: FF Cocon
content:
Part of: **[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : Rounded Typefaces**

Current URL:  
 [http://www.fontfont.com/fonts/cocon](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/www.fontfont.com/fonts/cocon "http://www.fontfont.com/fonts/cocon")  
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=418814](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=418814 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=418814")  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_cocon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_cocon/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_cocon/")  
 [http://www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=418814&AID=5529319](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=418814&AID=5529319 "http://www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=418814&AID=5529319")

Designed by [Evert Bloemsma](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Evert%20Bloemsma) 1998-2001

Published by [FontFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20140712131908/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontFont)

We all know the small spurs of the lowercase letters a, b, d, g, h, m, n, p, q, r and u. They are relics of the hand-written word where a round form is attached to a straight line. Bloemsma decided to find out what the result would be if they were left off; this proved a difficult starting point for a typeface. Beginning with the lower case a, he drew a family of rounded yet rather asymmetrical forms with details reminiscent of brush-strokes. The individual letters rather neutral, but as a group make FF Cocon™ a typeface of spirit and character.
author: AndrewSipe
